title: Daily Reminder Promos Serve No Real Purpose & Are About Pure Luck Of Not Getting Trolls/Flamers
body:
Title.

The problem with promos is that you don't feel **accomplishment** when you win them, you feel **relief** that you didn't get a troll or flamer. This is **NOT OK** because in a game like league whenever you move upward the latter you should feel accomplished not relieved that you didn't fall short and get a troll or flamer on your team.

There's a problem with the ranked system in general, and it's how dependant it is on luck, specially in the lowest division, regarding AFKs, trolls and so on.

You being a good player can shift those odds, but how many games until those odds manifest in real numbers?.

Food for thought:

In an experiment as simple as a coin-toss, the odds of each event happening are 50/50 (ofc), but for you to sum all events and actually see an actual 50/50 frequency of events, it would take an average of 400 tries. Which is to say, for the "true" odds of an event to manifest as such, it takes 400 hundred repetitions, and this is with a -simple- experiment, now imagine how much dumber it gets with a lot of variables.

Since we established that, for you to reflect your odds of winning based on skill, on three particular random-sampled games, that's ridiculous, pure luck.

The MMR system has it's flaws, and Blizzard has stated that for them (which uses a similar system to LoL) to accurately calculate the MMR of a player, that player must play at least 100 ranked games (which is ridiculous, of course).

So in short, if you -don't- have the skill, you can get lucky but over time, with more games played, you will migrate to your proper division.

If you -have- the skill, you -must- get lucky, but even if you don't, over time, with more games played, you will migrate to your proper division.

Ranked depends not purely on skill, but also on luck, and then on playing a LOT to nullify the luck factor.

playing alot does nothing to to address the luck as your rank is a rolling function not an average. I was plat 3 a few months ago random match maker shit on me for 3 weeks straight went like 37 losses in 40 games drop straight to gold 5, back up back down, gold 1 last week gold 5 today, I PLAY ALOT. All that matters is when you "stop" playing.  I can play 4000 matches be diamond 5, and then go on a 50 game losing streak and drop to gold 5 yet have played 4050 matches matches at that point and been diamond 5 for 4000 of them 4050 matches. the following week go on a 50 game win streak shoot up diamond 5 again. Yet if i stopped the week before i was gold 5.

Again rank means nothing unless you are d1 or bronze everything in between is a huge crap shoot i played vs silver who play better than diamonds i played with diamonds who play worse than a silver. system has too much luck and easy ways to manipulate the rankings. I'll give you perfect example, my friend account was diamond 4 oh i forgot to mention that he doesnt play much so his buddy who is a diamond player uses it "mostly" but everyone one in a while my friend who placed  each season in high bronze jumps on to shit the bed for a few matches in diamond and in between then the diamon guy jumps on to play a few, he mostly plays after the rank has dropped though because he likes to get shorter que times and stomp his lane opponent.

THIS IS VERY COMMON NOT RARE and is just one of many exploits that makes the rank system meaningless.

Then there is the beginning of the season...
So most games you lose arent much. No big deal right, you can regain the lost lp you can retry the promos.
But what about the placement?
Boom you had an afk, suddenly you drop from gold 5 to silver 1 for your starting rank.

To be entirely honest, a 37/40 losing streak does seem to fit into the "Seeping down to your proper rank" thing. You were probably WAY above the rank you should be via luck, and started seeping down appropiately. (Which, I may say, it's easy for us to notice when we lost a game due to someone in particular, but it's much harder to tell when we -won- a game due to someone in particular on the other team being a douche).

To recognize the system is luck is also to recognize that a lot of your hard-earned-wins were luck too.

It's a rolling function, but it averages out over time with the MMR system. MMR crashing sucks, but your skill level should adjust it appropiately over time.

If I lose my promo's, it's more like I "lost" the same amount of games. More often than not, I'm still only 10 lp or so away from them again, so I'm cool with redoing it.

However, the most ridiculously broken part of the experience are the people you get matched with.

Guess what? I failed. I lost three matches in a row after that because I got trolls, idiots, and AFK's.

In one of them a irelia got fed 10 kills by 10 minutes. In mid. AP irelia mid. How can you feed that as Malzahar.

The main issue is after asking, the Irelia was on her way UP (in promo's), while the people she was fighting were on their way DOWN(close to demotion).

You should only have to play promo's with people who are promoting as well. As it is now, more often than not, I'm paired with people who are about to get demoted, versus people two ranks higher or going up themselves.

Basically, it's MUCH , MUCH, harder to win a promo than it is to win a regular game, because you're being paired (typically) with people who are on their way down. Obviously, the best of say, bronze 1 will meet the worst of silver 5, but then it just degenerates into a goddamn luck fest.

Either you face more noob silver 5's, or you have more of them. That's the thing that decides the entire match. It degenerates into a  "who gets fed more" fest.

Trolls, flamers, most of those I guarantee are NOT the people who are in their promo's, but the ones who are about to be demoted.

Since EVERYONE cares about their promo's , make it so that ONLY people who are in their promo's are matched together.

Correct, some games are just losses. Janna F kennedy (one of the best 2500 or 2000 players on the server, Master tier and challenger at one point IIRC) once told me back in season 2 something like this, its not verbatim, but its close:

"When you play league, you will automatically lose about 40% of your games due to an enemy player getting fed, a teammate feeding, a teammate throwing, and afk, or other circumstances over which you have no control. Likewise and conversely, you will also automatically win about 40% of your matches for the same reasons, a teammate gets fed, enemy has an afk or throws, etc. The key to your destiny lies in how you approach and perform in the 20% of matches over which you can have a direct impact in the result."

I have rarely heard anything truer when it comes to league. What it boils down to is: are you gonna shine in those 20%? Will you do everything in your power to make those wins? And since you never know til the game ends which one of these percentages it applies to, will you play hard EVERY time assuming THIS game is one of the 20% you can affect?

I really like how they do challenger promotions, although under like high diamond theres not really a practical way to do that in every elo. Someone suggested being promoted at 140LP  which is roughly the same as winning 0-100 LP then 2 games after that assuming you gain 20 LP each, which would almost resemble the 2/3 promotion series. 

The thing I like more though is, once you hit for example 97 LP, you don't need to win a game after and miss out on like 25 LP that you'd gain from that win, considering it would only take the 3 lp you need to qualify you for a series. So if you were at 97 and got 25 for a win, you'd be at 122, instead of being at 100, losing 23 Leftover LP and being awarded a series that would make you win 2 games, which would in total probably put you around 160 LP anyways which is a higher risk of not making promotion because if the 140 LP promo system were in place, you would've been promoted after the first win (122 LP + 18 LP win =promo).

Promotion at 140:
